page.title: 17PLEASURE OF LIVING IN SESSAY
page.content: In 1516 Sir Thomas More called his imaginary state of ideal perfection 'Utopia'. There is nothing imaginary about Sessay, where in 1982 I chose to retire, but it is just about ideal. To relax in this{delightful setting}of fertile land and lush pastures, to breathe the forest-scented air wafting from the beautiful Hambleton Hills cannot be far from perfection. Free from many of today's stresses - here they are law-abiding citizens whose well- behaved children are taught to respect people, animals and property. Everyone is proud of the Tidy Village award so pretty gardens surround well- maintained homes and farms. But best of all{good-neighbourliness}abounds and happily without any of the age-gap barriers so often found today - just stable Yorkshire friendship. {Of course this is my Utopia.
